title: Jillian Allison
text:
Master of Environmental Data Science (2023) | Bren School of Environmental Science & Management | University of California, Santa Barbara
B.S. Earth Science- Geohydrology Emphasis (2022) | University of California, Santa Barbara


Stream Team Intern (January 2022 - September 2022) | Santa Barbara Channelkeeper | Santa Barbara, California
Water Quality Specialist (June 2022 - September 2022) | Valley Water | San Jose, California
Water Quality Intern (January 2020 - November 2020) | Cheadle Center for Biodiversity and Ecological Restoration | Goleta, California

title: About
text:
As an undergraduate at UCSB, I was a board member and a mentor for the new Earth Science department mentoring program (GEMSS). Here, I organized community events and panels focused on academic and professional development and received the Departmental Leadership Award for my efforts.Â 
I am currently pursuing a Master's degree in Environmental Data Science from the Bren School of Environmental Science and Management at UCSB. I am interested in the confluence of data science and water quality. I have held water quality monitoring roles at the Cheadle Center for Biodiversity and Ecological Restoration, Valley Water, and the Santa Barbara Channelkeeper. In these positions, I developed expertise in field hydrology, specifically surface water quality and its impact on the surrounding environment. Moving forward, I hope to continue collecting and analyzing hydrological data to find solutions to water resources issues.
